thread.title: WWE sex tape scandal as diva Paige confirms images were stolen and posted online without consent
thread.title_full: WWE sex tape scandal as diva Paige confirms images were stolen and posted online without consent

author: Aaron Flanagan
title: WWE sex tape scandal as diva Paige confirms images were stolen and posted online without consent
text:
Sport WWE sex tape scandal as diva Paige confirms images were stolen and posted online without consent Photos have emerged of Paige, while videos involving two male wrestlers have also been posted and shared on social media Share Paige has confirmed that she has been hacked (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Explicit images of WWE diva Paige have appeared online without her consent. 
The two-time Divas Champion has confirmed that her private photos were stolen and shared online. 
Paige, real name Saraya-Jade Bevis, also appeared to feature in a sex tape that included two male wrestlers, which also appeared on social media. 
The leak reportedly came after Paige's phone was hacked. 
One image shows the 24-year-old flashing her boobs, while in others she appears fully naked. Paige has been forced to confirm that the content posted was indeed hers (Photo: WireImage) 
Most of the images of the British wrestler are taken in a bathroom. 
Paige released a statement on Twitter confirming that her photos were posted online without permission. 
It said: “Personal and private photos of mine were stolen and unfortunately they were shared publicly without my consent.” 
The sex tape leak appears to show Paige taking part in sexual activity with one man in some scenes and then two men in another. 
There are also scenes where she appears to perform solo sex acts. Paige in WWE action during 2016 (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Paige will wait to speak to the WWE over the leak (Photo: NBCUniversal) 
Paige, who is currently out of action due to injury, was suspended by the WWE after 'wellness violations' last year. 
Some have suggested that she could be dropped by the company as a result, but others have defended her as she did not post the content herself. Like us on Facebook
